text: Hello, I am not sure I am using the debugger correctly: every time I try to run the debugger (in VS code, running in WSL on Windows) with "largish" amount of code, it takes tens of minutes for anything to happen with code that otherwise takes ~1s to run without the debugger. Is this behavior expected or should I look for errors in my setup? What could I try to speed it up?

elements.text: Hello, I am not sure I am using the debugger correctly: every time I try to run the debugger (in VS code, running in WSL on Windows) with "largish" amount of code, it takes tens of minutes for anything to happen with code that otherwise takes ~1s to run without the debugger. Is this behavior expected or should I look for errors in my setup? What could I try to speed it up?

text:
The issue is that when running the debugger, Julia runs in interpreted mode, which is really really slow. Much slower than other interpreters for other languages.
I haven't done this myself, but you can  run in mixed compiled / interpreted mode:
<https://github.com/JuliaDebug/Debugger.jl#compiled-mode>

text: Thanks, that seems like it could be really useful as I have a pretty good idea where the bugs are.

elements.text: Thanks, that seems like it could be really useful as I have a pretty good idea where the bugs are.

text: Ok, it turns out that for me the debugger integrated with VS code is really slow. Debugging from REPL with `using Debugger` is much faster.
